name: Hilton Buenavista Toledo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A perfect hotel in a perfect city. We stayed for two weeks of pure relaxation. Staff Excellent, helpful and friendly at all times. Facilities were exceptional...they even have an ATM in the hotel. location is good if you like quite....free shuttle bus to town was very much needed to keep the taxi cost down. it is too far to walk.
reviews.title: Can't fault it

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel on a work's seminar. Beautiful hotel, bedrooms are very spacious. Plenty to choose at meal times. Staff are very friendly. Outdoor pool. Lovely garden around the hotel. If it's due with work, plenty of different size conference rooms. Would recommend this hotel. A short bus shuttle ride into the main town of Toledo.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.
Hilton Toledo
reviews.text: Excellent hotel 3 km out of the historic centre. A free shuttle service to the Alcazar is provided throughout the day, and the same shuttle will pick up/drop pff at the train station for a cost of 3 euros per person. In the immediate area of the hotel there is nothing to see, but what is to see is the fine view of Toledo's historic core from the main entrance.

This is a very nice hotel, very near to all attractions in Toledo as it is only a short taxi ride (less than Euro 8) to the centre. The rooms are large and nicely done and their restaurant is also pretty good. We stayed there only for one night and so did not try out most of their facilities but we felt very comfortable and the staff were very friendly as well. The lobby is quite well done and impressive. The only downside was that internet access costs were extra and a bit on the higher side.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a weekend break in May. The building and gardens are very impressive with great views of Toledo in the back ground. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were large with huge beds and marble bathrooms. We only ate once at the hotel on the Sunday evening when the other two restaurants were closed so the menu was restricted to the room service menu, which didn't matter to us but may bother other people. The spa was amazing with a lovely pool outdoors and a beautiful indoor pool with multiple additional features. The only draw back was the spa is 25 Euros a day extra which we didn't know about and we used it both days (when we raised this with the manager he kindly refunded our money). There is a handy shuttle every two hrs to Toledo but the last minibus comes back at 9.15pm (it would be good if there was a later bus but taxis aren't very expensive). Would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is about 10 min drive outside of the city (figure an 8-10 euro cab drive). If you drive into the city yourself, the parking will cost you the same, so don't bother.
reviews.title: A very luxurious hotel outside of the walls

reviews.text: The hotel's public areas are beautiful. While we didn't explore the gardens, the pool, or the spa, judging from the restaurant and hallways, I'm sure they are stunning as well.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, 5 min drive to old town

reviews.text: The deluxe rooms are large, airy, very comfortable, with river views (which are nothing special though). Overall, what one would expect from a higher end Hilton.
reviews.title: The spot to stay at

reviews.text: If you are driving, allow youself 10 extra minutes to find the darn thing-getting out of it seems so easy...getting back in-not so much!
reviews.title: Memorable
Wondrful place to stay!
reviews.text: This was a fantastic hotel, where we stayed for three nights to attend a wedding in June 2013. By the way, the venue was terrific for the wedding, service and food were outstanding and the view from the outdoor areas where the wedding was held were quite nice. As a guest at the hotel, we found the rooms were large, modern and comfortable. The services were great in the hotel, and the reception staff was extremely helpful. Breakfast and all the food was delicious and well presented. The pool was nice, as were the outdoor terrace ares. The only disadvantage to this hotel, is that there isn't much around so you need to take a taxi each time you leave to go to the old town or anywhere else. That being said the taxi ride was always less than 5 euros and 5 minutes, so it wasn't that much of an inconvenience. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially over it's neighbor the Beatriz which is thirty years behind it, in terms of quality and comfort.
A 5-star jewel outside the fortified city walls !

description: The Hilton Buenavista Toledo Hotel, constructed around the former XVI century Buenavista Palace, is located just 5 minutes from the old city quarter of Toledo by the free transfer service. Based within a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the hotel is situated in the perfect location for exploring all the hidden treasures that the Imperial City of Toledo has to offer. Along with the city´s commercial and recreational districts, those wishing to visit the heart of Spain, the Hilton Buenavista Toledo Hotel is also the ideal starting point from which to discover Aranjuez, Cuenca, Ávila, and other points of interest near Madrid. Madrid City Centre is easily accessible via the AVE (High Speed Train), which the journey from Toledo to Madrid´s Atocha Station in just 30 minutes. The city of Madrid is then yours to explore, where you can find its main museums: the Prado, the Thyssen and the Reina Sofía within walking distance.The Madrid-Barajas International Airport is a short 45 minute drive taking the AP-41 or A-42 highways; however special tariffs can be applied to airport transfers upon request
